tit.j: 京都フィルハーモニー室内合奏団

sen.j: 京都フィルハーモニー室内合奏団（きょうとフィルハーモーニーしつないがっそうだん）は、京都市を本拠地とするオーケストラである。
sen.e: Kyoto Philharmonic Chamber Orchestra is an orchestra based in Kyoto City.
Kyoto Philharmonic Chamber Orchestra is an orchestra based in Kyoto City.
Kyoto Philharmonic Chamber Orchestra is an orchestra based in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 社団法人日本オーケストラ連盟の準会員。
sen.e: It is an associate member of Association of Japanese Symphony Orchestras.
It is an associate member of the Association of Japanese Symphony Orchestras.
It is an associate member of the Association of Japanese Symphony Orchestras.
It was established in 1972.

sen.j: 各種コンサートの他、学校音楽観賞会を京都府内の小学校で行うなどクラシック音楽の啓蒙活動に取り組んでいる。
sen.e: In addition to various concerts, it is conducting enlightenment activities for classical music through the performance at elementary schools in Kyoto Prefecture.
In addition to various concerts, this orchestra conducts educational campaigns for classical music through their performances at elementary schools in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 2000年に特定非営利活動法人（NPO）となり、活動が本格的した。
sen.e: Its activities became vigorous after it became a nonprofit organization (NPO) in 2000.
Their activities became full-scale after becoming a nonprofit organization (NPO) in 2000.

sen.j: 指揮者は置かれておらず、現在18名のメンバーで構成されている。
sen.e: It has no conductor, and it consists of 18 persons at present.
They play without a conductor and presently consist of eighteen members.

sen.e: They play without a conductor and presently consist of eighteen members.

sen.j: 共演者は佐藤俊太郎、有田正広、千住真理子らがおり、2005年11月12日には第21回京都賞受賞のため来日していたニコラウス・アーノンクールが公開リハーサルという形で指揮した。
sen.e: It performed with Shuntaro SATO, Masahiro ARITA and Mariko SENJU, and Nikolaus Harnoncourt conducted it, in the form of public rehearsal, on November 12, 2005 when he visited Kyoto to attend the 21st award ceremony of the Kyoto Prize.
